title: Automated Form Processing
cardDescription: Create an RPA bot that extracts data from structured sources and automatically fills web forms. Learn the fundamentals of UI automation and data mapping.

subHeader.subTitle: Challenge Overview
subHeader.description: In this challenge, you'll create an RPA bot that automates the tedious process of data entry. You'll extract customer information from a structured Excel file and automatically populate a web form, complete with validation and submission. This mirrors real-world scenarios where businesses need to process hundreds of forms efficiently.

subHeader.subTitle: What You'll Learn
subHeader.description: Throughout this challenge, you'll master essential RPA concepts including RPA Studio interface and project creation, data extraction from Excel sources, UI element identification and interaction, loop operations for batch processing, and basic error handling and validation.

subHeader.subTitle: Business Scenario
subHeader.description: ABC Corp receives customer registration forms daily that need to be entered into their web portal. Currently, an employee spends 3 hours daily on this manual task. Your RPA bot will automate this process, reducing the time to 5 minutes while eliminating human errors.

proTip: Take your time with UI element selection. Proper selectors are key to reliable automation.

tutorialSteps.stepDescription: Start by opening RPA Studio from your Infor OS tenant. You'll create a new automation project that will serve as the foundation for your form processing bot.

stepActions.step: Click "New Project" in RPA Studio
Name your project "FormProcessor"
Select "VB.NET" as the programming language
Choose "Process" as the project type

stepScreenshots.image: Screenshot showing the New Project dialog with FormProcessor name and VB.NET selected

tutorialSteps.stepDescription: Your bot needs to navigate to the web form where data will be entered. The Open Browser activity establishes the web session and opens the target URL.

stepActions.step: Drag "Open Browser" from Activities panel to the design canvas
Set URL property to: https://challenge.infor.com/form1
Choose browser type (Chrome recommended)
Set BrowserType to "Chrome" in properties

tutorialSteps.stepDescription: Your bot needs to read customer data from the provided Excel file. The Read Range activity will extract this data into a format your bot can process.

stepActions.step: Add "Read Range" activity inside the browser scope
Set Workbook path to the provided customer data file
Configure Sheet name as "CustomerData"
Set Range as "A1" to read all data starting from headers
Create output variable "customerDataTable"

stepScreenshots.image: Read Range properties showing workbook path and output variable configuration

tutorialSteps.stepDescription: To process multiple customer records, you'll need a loop structure. The For Each Row activity will iterate through each row of your Excel data.

stepActions.step: Add "For Each Row" activity after Read Range
Set DataTable property to "customerDataTable"
This creates a "row" variable for each iteration
All form filling activities go inside this loop

stepScreenshots.image: For Each Row activity showing DataTable input and the loop scope ready for form activities

tutorialSteps.stepDescription: Now you'll connect your Excel data to the web form fields. Each "Type Into" activity will fill a specific form field with data from the current row.

stepActions.step: Add "Type Into" activity for each form field:
Use UI Explorer to select each form field element

stepScreenshots.image: Multiple Type Into activities showing field selectors and row data expressions

tutorialSteps.stepDescription: After filling all fields, submit the form and verify successful submission. This ensures your automation completed correctly for each record.

stepActions.step: Add "Click" activity for the Submit button
Use UI Explorer to select the submit button element
Add "Find Element" activity to detect success message
Configure timeout of 10 seconds for success confirmation
Add delay between submissions if processing multiple records

stepScreenshots.image: Click activity for submit button and Find Element activity for success message detection

tutorialSteps.stepDescription: Execute your completed automation with the test data. Monitor the process to ensure all records are processed correctly and capture your completion code.

stepActions.step: Click "Run" in RPA Studio to execute your bot
Watch as it processes all 5 test records automatically
Look for the success message after final submission
Copy the completion code that appears (format: INF-XXXX)
This code proves successful automation completion

stepScreenshots.image: RPA bot running and displaying the final success message with completion code

protipSuccess.tip: Reliable Selectors: Use ID or Name attributes when selecting UI elements - they're more stable than position-based selectors.
Error Handling: Add delays between actions if the web form is slow to respond.
Testing: Test with one record first before processing the full dataset.

challengeValidationMethods.description: Run your RPA bot with the provided test data. After processing all records, the system will display a unique completion code. Enter that code below to validate your solution.
challengeValidationMethods.text: Look for the success message that appears after processing all 5 test records. The message will contain an 8-character code starting with "INF-". This code is generated dynamically and proves you completed the automation successfully.
challengeValidationMethods.label: Completion Code

troubleshootsteps.step: • Ensure your solution processes all test data completely
• Check that all required activities are included in your project
• Verify API calls receive successful responses (200 status)
• File uploads must be valid RPA Studio export files

title: Document Classification
cardDescription: Build an AI model that automatically categorizes incoming documents. Explore machine learning capabilities within the Infor OS platform.

challengeValidationMethods.description: Your RPA bot should make an API call to our validation endpoint as part of the automation. This proves your bot successfully interacted with external systems and received the expected response.
challengeValidationMethods.text: Add an HTTP Request activity to your RPA flow with the following configuration:
challengeValidationMethods.label: Completion Code

troubleshootsteps.step: • Ensure your solution processes all test data completely
• Check that all required activities are included in your project
• Verify API calls receive successful responses (200 status)
• File uploads must be valid RPA Studio export files

title: Custom UI Widget
cardDescription: Develop a custom dashboard widget that displays real-time metrics. Learn how to extend the platform with custom UI components.

title: API Data Sync
cardDescription: Create an integration that synchronizes data between external systems using REST APIs. Master the fundamentals of system connectivity.
